net.kuujo.vertigo.network

Interface ConnectionConfig

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentConfigurable, Config<ConnectionConfig>, ConnectionConfigurable, JsonSerializable

    public interface ConnectionConfig
extends Config<ConnectionConfig>, ComponentConfigurable, ConnectionConfigurable
    A connection represents a link between two components within a network.

    When a connection is created, each instance of the source component will be setup to send messages to each instance of the target component. How messages are routed to multiple target instances can be configured using selectors.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Field Detail

      • CONNECTION_SOURCE

        static final String CONNECTION_SOURCE
        source is an object defining the connection source. See the ConnectionConfig.Source documentation for details on the source structure.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_TARGET

        static final String CONNECTION_TARGET
        target is an object defining the connection target. See the ConnectionConfig.Target documentation for details on the target structure.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_HOOKS

        static final String CONNECTION_HOOKS
        hooks is an array defining connection hooks. Each element in the array must be an object containing a hook field which indicates the hook class name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • CONNECTION_SELECTOR

        static final String CONNECTION_SELECTOR
        selector is an object defining the connection selector. The selector definition should contain a type which indicates the selector type, e.g. round-robin, random, hash, fair, all, or custom. If a custom selector is indicated then an additional selector field must be provided which indicates the custom selector class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values
